comments.body: So we are linking `libJupyROOT` with `libpython` again. Do you understand why this is necessary for `libJupyROOT` on Windows but not for `libROOTPythonizations` or `libcppyy`? In the end, the three libraries are extension modules that are used from Python: `import libname`.
No idea, for now I just want to make it build successfully. I'll check later what is really needed and how to make it fully working on Windows...

diffHunk:
@@ -1,1 +46,50 @@    set_target_properties(${libname} PROPERTIES WINDOWS_EXPORT_ALL_SYMBOLS TRUE)
    set_target_properties(${libname} PROPERTIES SUFFIX ".pyd")
    target_link_libraries(${libname} PUBLIC Core  ${python_library})
  elseif(APPLE)
    target_link_libraries(${libname} PUBLIC -Wl,-bind_at_load -Wl,-undefined -Wl,dynamic_lookup Core)
